page.title: 05WOODLANDS: WARLEY, ESSEX
page.content: The block contains some relatively mature woodland, e.g.{Barrack Wood}and {Holden's Wood,}although tree height and species composition is not as mature as in Weald park further north, where large Oaks are dominant. Some { {Oaks}occur in the block, however, and are likely to emerge as dominants, in association with{Beech.}Quadrat sampling in the woodland revealed distinct clustering of certain tree species. In one location {Beech}was the most numerous, in another{Sweet {Chestnut}and in a third (atypically){ {Corsican Pine.}The relative maturity of the woodlands in reflected in the lack of ground cover: in the quadrats only 9.4% of the ground was actually covered with vegetation - the most common cover being{moss}and{grass, followed by{ferns, bracken, bluebells, {angelica,ivy,nettles}and{brambles.
